content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is an example implementation in Julia:
```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    filter(x -> x[1] == uppercase(x[1]), words)
end
```
This function uses the built-in `filter` function to return a new list that includes only those elements (`words`) from the input list for which the provided function (`x -> x[1] == uppercase(x[1])`) returns true. 

In our case, this function checks if the first character of each word is a capital letter (using `uppercase(x[1])`). If it is not, then that word will be removed from the new list.
